lines.text: Watson, I think you should perform a post-mortem on this woman.
Good God, Holmes, she was ripped apart by crocodiles!

[about her autograph book]
Pablo Picaso drew me a little picture, but I couldn't make it out, so I threw it away.
Really? I wouldn't expect a lady of any caste to say such a thing.
Are you absolutely sure it will be tonight, Holmes? It's almost tomorrow.
I have been wrong on three occasions, Watson, who can tell, this might be the fourth.
It appears that Signor Marconi and his wife are on holiday, on their way to America.
On that brand new vessel, the Titanic, I should imagine.
No, no, the maiden voyage was delayed, so they had to change to another vessel.
Well I never. So you had the real stone all the time, and the tieves had the fake one. Could that be true?
When you write the story, Watson, you decide.
